wikipedia_page.main: Sir James Heath, 1st Baronet (26 January 1852 – 24 December 1942) was a businessman and Conservative Party politician in the United Kingdom.

response: * Sir James Heath, 1st Baronet (1852–1942), British Conservative Member of Parliament
|data-sort-value="Heath,James"| Sir James Heath, 1st Baronet || Cricket (first-class) || MP for North West Staffordshire (1892–1906)

Born at Newcastle-under-Lyme in Staffordshire on 29 May 1856, he was the younger son of Robert Heath (died 1893), owner of coal mines and iron works, His elder brother was Sir James Heath, 1st Baronet. He was educated at Clifton College"Clifton College Register" Muirhead, J.A.O. p28: Bristol; J.W Arrowsmith for Old Cliftonian Society; April, 1948 and Brasenose College, Oxford, where he graduated MA.
